Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Laws \Laws\ n. the first five books of the Old Testament, also called {The Law} and {Torah}.
Syn: Pentateuch, Law of Moses, Torah. [WordNet 1.5]
Laws n : the first of three divisions of the Hebrew Scriptures comprising the first five books of the Hebrew Bible considered as a unit [syn: {Torah}, {Pentateuch}]
